messages: b8a61a3ed9fe9abe3acaf37e9de651d8 (10:42): anybody mind telling me why this doesnt render correctly in IE?
81d9c35d11b75831e6a607d15ddb18c8 (11:02): i want to make a text box that is the exact width of a div, any way to do this and have it resize if the div changes size?

ca8af24e270a86c6838b4edb4addeec1 (11:05): i have 1 form with 2 textbox and 2 submit button.. those are: Forgot Password Reminder and Forgot ID Reminder.. How to make when user fill the second textbox, then press ENTER is like click the second submit button, because right now when do enter enter will click the first submit button. I already did tabindex but didn't effect.
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:06): georgex: put it in two forms, i guess
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:06): You could capture an enter key (keycode 10 or 13) and set a hidden input's value
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:07): Or use two forms, yes, and avoid script.
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:07): or use the same submit button for both options
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:07): One submit button would be less confusing
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:12): is there something wrong with <!-- <?xml version="1.0"?> ... //--> ?
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:12): in my editor it changes syntax highlighting so the next line after the ?xml... ?> is not comment
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:13): humm... why is it wigging out then?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:13): The editor seems to be highlighting when it sees matching < and >, not looking at comments
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:13): it's doing it in mozilla's view source
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:14): humm... jedit appears to display as I was expecting
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:15): even weirder...Ie appears to display it fine
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:16): Does Moz render the page incorrectly?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:16): Try putting <!-- and --> on their own lines
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (11:17): they are...it was just easier to enter it on one in ir
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:17): Weird... assuming that the comment text doesn't contain "--", then even a full SGML parser should count it as a comment
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:18): Maybe a *ml validator could catch an error, if there is one.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:19): Actually... check the page info dialog in Moz to see if it's in quirks mode. That might explain why it's parsing it weirdly.
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:21): ermm.. push it below something else? like below the <title>?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:21): That might be the problem, yeah, but should it matter?
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:22): most browsers, including firefox isn't that strict about the sgml implementation, iirc
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (11:23): I'd hope tag soup parsers would be more liberal about that
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (11:47): omg A*S*YS, Hellrasier, BeXta and other producers are using myspace
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (11:47): wtf does page have to full of someones crap and add up to megabytes?
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (11:51): is there a tag for it
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:52): and that you can use the for attribute
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (11:53): is it for blind people or something?
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:53): click on the label and you'll get focused on the input control
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (11:53): well wouldnt it do that anyway
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:54): arooni: the usage should be like <label for="target">a</label><input id="target">
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (11:54): so then i can click on the text which describes the input, and it will take me to the input?
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:55): it's in the specs, so most UAs should support it, where it is relevant
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:56): it's not relevant in a text browser
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:57): i haven't used a text browser though. but i think it is possible to support it
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (11:57): i have used a command line interface that provides for the mouse
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (11:58): but there are text browsers that don't use mouse
